reviews.review_msg: David has to be the most soft spoken prof I ever took a class with.  But despite his initial shy demeanor, once he gets on a roll, he is interesting, passionate, and funny.  It was a pleasure attending lectures and tutorials.  And yes, he has great eyes.

This class was a little disappointing. I'd heard great things about him, but his lectures were dry and he never got on the students who never contributed to discussion like he should have(its 3rd yr, you'd better speak up!), no real discussion was had. He was always late 10mins for both lec and tut. ALWAYS. Texts were good. Nice guy though.

Peter is a really kind person who cares a lot about his students. Go to see him during his hours and he is super helpful. Yes, he definitely likes the sound of his own voice, but what prof doesn't? He's interesting and a fair marker. Highly recommended.

Self-righteous prick. Monopolizes student-led seminars, and grades unfairly. On the plus side, chooses great reading material and comments extensively on papers. If you can get past his arrogance, he's not so bad.

I really enjoyed his course, he is a fantastic prof. Take his cdn lit courses! Clear, prepared, organized, and interesting. Didn't feel particularly friendly, but u definitely feel that he's got it together. Ditto about the reading list - superb. Has a final, 2 papers, and presentation.

I was surprised to see him rated as 'hot' because to be honest he looks a bit creepy. Nonetheless our course's reading list was the best reading list I've ever had. His marking is harder than average and he does go off on tangents, but I would recommend taking a course with him as he chooses interesting topics and really incorporates discussion.

Whatley loves to use the full four hours for lectures. The lectures are really boring and the only really teaches you two concepts in 13 weeks. He is really nice and understanding and gives realy good feedback. Only two essays and a final. He also chooses really good books to read but the lectures are really dry.

John was passionate, brilliant, gave great feedback, open about the final exam, was approachable and available to help,wanted us to do well. The only things is the lectures were dense, but he included group discussions too. Lots of readings, but I actually learned a lot about theory. Overall he is a great teacher who wants you to succeed.

Here's the thing about Clint- he has bad reviews, obviously. But if you are willing to put in the work, he recognizes your effort and all is peachy-kean. He can come across as arrogant, but part of it is his expectation that those who take his class will be able to fit his standard. So while it's challenging, I think it's worth it.

Mr. Ogden is a great prof. I think I would have been bored out of my mind if he was not the prof teaching Cdn Lit since 1920. I have learnt a lot from him. He is funny, easygoing and very smart. I would recommend considering Ogden as your prof for a Cdn Lit course!
he's very engaging and funny. also seems like a fair marker. one of the best english professors, i'd recommend him to anyone

I think most of what others said are true, her classes tends to slightly skewed towards the 'cultural/aboriginal studies'. Her reading list is good and sometimes she is not clear on what she wants. But she is a prof that genuinely wants you to do well and responsive to questions. Overall she is a great prof in her own way I guess.

Sophie McCall is an amazing lecturer. She really knows how to engage students and brings forward interesting discussion questions. Fair marker. Easy to talk to and always seems interested in helping students. Engl 357 had a great book list chosen by her.

She's a nice person but as a prof the class was disorganized. The lecture content was very superficial, never went in depth with analysis. Barely had to show up to class, just attend tutorials and you'll do fine. Presentation sign ups are on the first day, look into the books before hand for when you need to choose and defend one.
